part1.text: Anakin Skywalker started his journey as a young, prodigy podracer. A slave boy without a father, he was discovered by Qui-Gon Jinn and Obi-Wan Kenobi on planet Tatooine.

part2.text: Anakin quickly evolved over time during the Clone Wars. His talents were undeniable and he quickly advanced to the role of a Jedi General, fighting courageously alongside his clone troopers.

part3.text: Despite his heroics during the Clone Wars, Anakin was constantly at odds with the Jedi Council, fueling his frustration and leading him to the dark path.

part4.text: Anakin's turning point was when he intervened in a crucial moment, saving Chancellor Palpatine instead of Mace Windu. This led to his allegiance with the Dark Side and marked his conversion to Darth Vader.

part5.text: Darth Vader served as the Empire's relentless enforcer, spreading fear and dominating galaxy. Yet, the light inside him wasn't completely extinguished.

part6.text: The turning point happened when Vader was faced with a choice to save his son, Luke Skywalker, or continue his allegiance with the Emperor. Choosing his son over his master, Vader returned back to the light.
